body: Dear Patient, Thank you for your 5* review. We are grateful for your acknowledgement that our Receptionists are welcoming and try their best at all times. Best wishes, Charleen (Deputy PM)

Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback.  We are sorry to hear that your recent experience was not up to your expected standard.  The reception staff advised me that you were appropriately directed to complete e-consultation as they do with all other patients. We believe systems for accessing care need to be transparent, perceptibly fair and appropriate to the needs of all patient groups for this reason we have adopted total digital triage model where patients are requested to complete e-consultation instead of calling at 8am in the morning rush, spend a lot of time seeking an appointment, and sometimes if they get through only to be told ring for 8am appointment tomorrow morning as they are none left. In this type of appointment system some patients miss out because there are so many people calling at the same time. 
For cystitis cases, NHS advice can be found on this link https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/cystitis/ 

I can confirm that you were contacted within given time frame after you completed e-consultation. You were given a same day appointment at our GP Enhanced service, which is extension to our service and they can see your notes and prescribe like any other GP at Penrhyn Surgery and ask you to collect your prescription from pharmacy as we would normally do at Penrhyn Surgery. 

We are working with Waltham Forest Federation to get urgent patients seen and your appointment was booked same day in the evening at this Service. This appointment was a telephone appointment and not a face to face appointment to save you time and eliminate some of the most stressful parts of visiting the doctor but if a doctor issues prescription then it is patient responsibility to arrange to pick this up from pharmacy. We are unable to arrange transport for these purposes or provide prescription due to the fact that patient prefer to pick prescription up from their practice as this is responsibility of consulting doctor and waste of NHS resources if same thing is done twice.   When you called us again the receptionist took your query to the On-call doctor to make sure you are receiving right appointment she also offered to check with 111 if an earlier appointment can be arranged but 111 again booked you for 4pm in afternoon with the same service. The NHS is currently experiencing some of the most severe pressures in its 70-year history. That’s why all GPs in North East London are working differently now. Please see attached poster from our CCG  https://northeastlondonccg.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/NHS-GP-access-A3-poster-FINAL.pdf 
We are working at our best trying to accommodate all patients, respond to all queries and book appointments for all patients according to their clinical need and we appreciate the support and understanding from our patients and their feedback whilst we face new challenges and more demand on services. 
Wishing you good health 
Many Thanks
Management Team at Penrhyn Surgery

I'm sorry to hear that you've had problems getting an appointment. We urge patients to speak to us directly about any issues before posting on this site so that we have the opportunity to address your concerns. If you have the opportunity to contact the practice via e-mail (inbox.cheadlemedical@nhs.net) if possible we will be happy to investigate further.

Demand on GP practices is higher than it's ever been - we're doing our best to help all patients and welcome any feedback which supports us to do that. Rest assured we are doing what we can to recruit and train more receptionists and doctors, as well as undertaking reviews internally to try to increase our capacity as far as safely possible.

Dear Maria, 
Thank you for your lovely comments. It is so lovely to hear that you are really pleased with your care.

kindest regards,
The Patient Experience Team

I'm sorry to hear that you've had problems. We urge patients to speak to us directly about any issues before posting on this site so that we have the opportunity to address your concerns. Dear Sir/Madam - Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry that you had a problem when you tried to register with our Practice. We do operate a registration process and new patients are given a specific time and date to attend to register with us. The process allows our reception & admin staff enough time for registration documentation to be fully completed and also for any health checks or medication reviews to be arranged for the new patients. This process also alleviates disruption to service provision for our existing patients. 
Regarding your comment that the receptionist ending your call, this is obviously not acceptable and I will be investigating and discussing your comments at our next Practice meeting in order to support learning across the team. 
Once more I am sorry that your experience was not a positive one.

Thank you for your feedback and I'm very sorry you have had such a poor experience and for any distress caused. Unfortunately we have been affected by the sudden rise in Covid as have most of the NHS services. However our staff really are dedicated to maintaining our high quality service with the least disruption possible. If you feel you wish to discuss this with us please call 0345 300 8090 to speak with a manager.

signature: Shona Lawrence, Patient Experience Manager, NHS 24
body:
Hi Audy29  
Thanks so much for sharing your experience on Care Opinion. I hope you are doing much better and wish you all the best for the New Year.  
I'm sorry you were so unwell that you needed to call 111 so soon after 'the bells'. Many thanks for your kind words about the staff who managed your call. I'm glad you felt that our Call Handler 'Ian', was efficient and calm. It sounds as though our Nurse also put you are ease with a referral to the Out of Hours Service where you were then contacted by Laura to progress your care.  
As yours is our first Care Opinion story of this year, it would be great to be able to share this with the staff involved. When you feel up to it, if you would be kind enough to contact me directly and provide some additional detail, then I would be able to share your story. It would be great for our staff to see how valued their care is by reading your positive comments. You can contact me on 07814 299944 or by email at [Patient.Experience@nhs24.scot.nhs.uk](mailto:Patient.Experience@nhs24.scot.nhs.uk)  
I will also ask the Care Opinion Team to tag your local Health Board into your story as Laura, the Nurse who called you back, is employed by them.  
Thanks again for getting in touch. I wish you a full and speedy recovery.  
Take care meantime.  
Shona

signature: Shona Lawrence, Patient Experience Manager, NHS 24
body:
Hi Audy29  
Thanks so much for contacting me directly. It was a pleasure to hear from you. I'm pleased you are doing so much better and wish you well for your continued recovery.  
How lovely that our first Care Opinion story of the year was provided by a staff member! Such a stark reminder that staff who work within NHS settings can sometimes find themselves in need of the services we support every day. Having to call 111 was clearly not an ideal start to the New Year, however I'm sure it was reassuring for you to know that NHS 24 and the Out of Hours Service were available to you when you felt so unwell.  
With the additional information you have provided, I will share your story directly with the staff involved. We will also share your experience more widely within NHS 24 so that staff can see the positive impact their care had on you.  
Thanks again for sharing your experience.  
Take care meantime  
Shona

body:
Dear SJC123  
I was very saddened to read your post and of the poor experience your relative, you and family members have endured. It falls short of the way we aim to treat people.  
We would like to take learning from this series of poor experiences that you have mentioned so that we can make improvements. Would it be possible for you to provide more details so that we can look into matters. If so please could you contact me via patient.experience@ulh.nhs.uk  
Regarding meals, there is a staff awareness campaign launching very soon within the hospitals surrounding nutrition and hydration, particularly in relation to patients living with cognitive impairments and learning disabilities.  
We certainly do not wish anyone to feel that there has been a lack of compassion and we need to make changes to address this.  
Regards  
Sharon

signature: Kirsty Knox, Heart Failure Nurse, Enhanced Care / Heart Failure Service, SHSCT
body:
Hello  
Thanks for taking the time to share your experience of 1 north.  
I am glad to read that you have found the staff here on the ward are nice and that the food has been good. Hopefully this made you feel more at ease during your stay with us in 1 North.  
I am however sad to read that you have found it difficult to sleep at night. It can be a very busy environment at night particularly if patients deteriorate. 1 North also has the unfortunate extra addition of beeping cardiac monitors which does not help with the noise levels, they can drive us a little mad when we have to listen to them on night shift so I can't imagine what it must be like trying to sleep in that environment. I will pass on your comments to the rest of the staff, particularly the night staff. If there is something that is disrupting your sleep please feel comfortable to alert us and we will try our best to resolve the issue at the time.  
I really hope you feel better soon.  
Many thanks  
Kirsty
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

signature: Kirsty Knox, Heart Failure Nurse, Enhanced Care / Heart Failure Service, SHSCT
body:
Hello  
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience of 1 North.  
I'm sorry to read that you are currently awaiting bypass surgery and that you have had to wait with us over Christmas, that must have been particularly difficult. Hopefully our ward Santa Claus was good to you though.  
I'm glad that you have found the 1 North staff to be 'fantastic' and that you have felt well informed throughout your stay- we really take pride in involving our patients in their care.  
Covid has been a scary time for everyone over the past few years and I'm sorry to read that you don't feel safe staying on the ward due to the lack of cleanliness. I am glad to read that you are able to access wipes etc but its disappointing that your in a situation that you have to do that. I will pass your comments onto the domestic services, but please don't feel that you are 'pestering' staff, if you see something not up to the standard you expect please inform us so that we can resolve the issue.  
I hope you get a date for your bypass surgery soon (if you haven't already) and that you recover well.  
Thank you  
Kirsty

Dear Anonymous,
Thank you for your comments regarding the appointment system.
I would like to point out that we have not used the "on the day booking" only before Covid, we always had a mixture of pre-bookable appointments and some for on the day issues that people have.
Unfortunately with the need to ensure that patients coming into the Practice are screened for Covid symptoms we must use an "on the day" booking system and this will be in use until the Pandemic is finally over. 
I do realise that this is not the ideal situation but we must protect patients and staff as much as possible during the Pandemic, which I am sure you will agree is a priority for us all.

I have spoken with the ultrasound manager and am assured that usually the scan appointments run to good time. Sometimes, if women are seen by the specialist fetal medicine team then there can be delays as the scans may be more complex. Unfortunately, we are unable to permit children attending the scan department due to the focus required by the sonographer while performing the scan, very detailed measurements are taken and full attention is required. Also at the moment social distancing is another challenge for the team, as the clinical rooms are very small in the scan department. 
We do however always expect our staff to be friendly and approachable, therefore we would encourage you to contact our PALS department on 0118 322 8338 or email PALS@royalberkshire.nhc.uk so we can properly review the care provided. We hope from here on your experience with maternity services is much improved.
Kerry Taylor

Dear Nilekasa,

I am sorry you have had a number of bad experiences getting though to the Practice.

At particular times of the day, especially at 08:00 when the telephone lines open, there can be a long wait while the telephone calls are answered in the order that they called in.

I acknowledge that there were some difficulties with the telephone system which meant that some callers did not get through to a member of our team despite hearing a ringing tone at their end.  We believe these have now been resolved.

Thankfully for us all the NHS does not provide treatment based on the ability of the patient to afford the service or the treatment that they receive.  

The need to provide adequate funding to Primary care and enough clinical staff, including GP's, to meet the current massively increased demand from patients for the service is a huge issue which requires government intervention.

I am available to discuss any issue that you or any other Patient has with the Practice, so please contact me via the Practice, by phone or email and I will investigate it and respond directly.

Thanks

William Symons - Practice Manager

Dear Patient

We are sorry you are not satisfied with the service provided by Drayton Medical Practice.

We are always very busy on the lead up to Christmas. However, this year for various reasons that have come about from the Covid pandemic we have seen even further increase in demand. Our priority is always to ensure the phone lines are fully staffed and relocate staff away from other admin duties if necessary to fulfil this.

We encourage patients to contact us by phone in order to reduce the Covid transmission risk and maintain social distancing. However, we understand this method is not suitable for all patients, so we also have a member of staff on duty in the reception area to deal with any such face-to-face queries.

Patients can also access an online tool called eConsult via the practice website. eConsult offers around the clock NHS self-help information, signposting to services, and a symptom checker.
eConsult also offers the facility to access non urgent advice from a practice GP or other Healthcare Professional without the need to call the practice. This can be obtained by completing an online form.

We are sorry that you were frustrated in not getting through to the practice on 27th and 28th December but as these were Bank Holidays the practice was closed. Our telecom supplier automatically sets our phone system to play our closed message on Bank Holidays. On investigation we note this setting was is place so we are unsure why the correct message was not relayed on this occasion. We will submit a report to the supplier for further investigation.

Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for your kind comments regarding your recent experience at the practice. I am glad that the clinician that you spoke to was able to help and provide reassurance in what must have been a very difficult time.

I look forward to sharing your feedback with the practice team.

Kind regards

Mark Little

Hi Carol

Royal Primary Care

Dear Patient
We are always grateful for feedback whether it is negative or positive and are sorry to hear you are dissatisfied with the service you have received, however it is very difficult for us to resolve an issue when comments are added anonymously.  We have a complaint system which would provide you with support when appropriate and we will work with you to resolve any problems.  Please do contact us directly and we can explain the systems in place to support you with requesting medication.  Our Pharmacy Technician is available most mornings for any such queries.  No one is being denied access to their GP by this Practice.  We offer online, telephone and face to face appointments and are working to the guidelines provided to General Practices as we always have.  These guidelines include recommendations for the safe prescribing of medication and we have to comply with these.  Please do contact us directly and we will be happy to look into your concerns.

We are sorry for your recent experience at ward 16, RVI and would be very interested in exploring this further with you. If you would like to discuss this please contact our Patient Relations Department on 0191 2231382 or e-mail nuth.patient.relations@nhs.net with further details of the issues regarding your parents care.
Thank you the feedback you recently posted on NHS Choices which is greatly appreciated by all of our Practice Team.

signature: Jane Danforth, Involvement & Experience Officer, Involvement, Experience and Volunteering Team, Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Trust
body:
Dear snowcz87  
Firstly I must apologise for the time it has taken to respond to your feedback. I was sorry to read that the ulcer has not healed despite lengthy treatment at another hospital.  
It was encouraging however, to hear that the treatment so far from the specialist ulcer clinic in East Leake looks promising.  
The specialist nurses will be particularly pleased to know that you have taken the time to share your experience on Care Opinion and that you feel confident in their ability to care for you.  
I wish you well for the future and hope you will be able to gain full recovery of this wound.  
Kind Regards  
Jane
